intro: Cyathostemma glabrum, commonly known as the smooth cyathostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent-like growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid or semi-arid regions.
